prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(openxlsx)
library(reshape2)
library(limma)
library(gplots)
library(pcaMethods)

# Read count table
count_table <- read.xlsx("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx", sheet = 1)
# Remove first row as it contains gene names
count_table <- count_table[-1,]
# Convert count table to matrix
count_matrix <- as.matrix(count_table[, -1])

# Read annotation data
annotation_data <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

# Identify unique groups in annotation data
groups <- unique(annotation_data$group)

# Perform statistical tests for each group
group_specific_genes <- list()

for(group in groups){
  # Subset count matrix based on samples in the respective group
  group_samples <- annotation_data[annotation_data$group == group, "diagnosis"]
  group_count_matrix <- count_matrix[, group_samples]

  # Perform differential expression analysis using limma
  design <- model.matrix(~group_samples)
  fit <- lmFit(group_count_matrix, design)
  fit <- contrasts.fit(fit, contrasts = makeContrasts(group_samplesgroup_specific_genes[[group]] <- rownames(topTable(fit, adjust="BH", sort.by = "B")$B > 0, xlim = PC1_range, ylim = PC2_range, col = annotation_data$group[PCA_specific_genes], xlab = "PC1", ylab = "PC2", main = "PCA plot colored by group")
}

# Set seed for reproducibility
set.seed(123)

# Perform PCA on the count_matrix
pca <- pca(count_matrix, method = "svd")

# Plot PCA using group specific genes
group_indices <- match(rownames(pca$x), group_specific_genes)
PC1_range <- range(pca$x[,1])
PC2_range <- range(pca$x[,2])
plot(pca$x[,1], pca$x[,2], xlim = PC1_range, ylim = PC2_range, col = annotation_data$group[group_indices], xlab = "PC1", ylab = "PC2", main = "PCA plot colored by group")
